urls.title: Help Callum 360 Experience | The Flood Hub
urls.description: Lancaster University, SeriousGeoGames at the University of Hull and the Environment Agency have teamed up to produce this new 360 virtual reality experience. The video tells the real story of Callum, a young boy whose house was flooded, using his own words and seeing through his eyes. Help Callum brings Lancaster‚Äôs research with flood-affected young people together with Hull‚Äôs experience in using virtual reality and 360 videos to bring flood experiences to life. The video puts you in Callum‚Äôs situation

urls.title: Omnishambles - Mark Avery
urls.description: Have you ever had a colleague at work who promises everything but consistently delivers work which is of poor quality and usually arrives late too? They‚Äô re the worst aren‚Äô t they? They may be well-meaning, they may be the life and soul of the party and great fun socially but they are a total waste of space as far as the work environment is concerned. Over-promising and under-delivering work colleagues tend not to stay around for long. DEFRA reminds me of those colleagues. The problem is that we are

tweets.text:
DEFRA's approach to the environment is an omnishambles, but it is merely a case study in the wider government omnishambles https://t.co/zIJtjimuG0

#peat #badgers #farming #environment @DefraGovUK @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @pow_rebecca @VictoriaPrentis @LabourDefra

urls.title: Guest post: How global warming is making power plants produce less electricity | Carbon Brief
urls.description: The coal, gas and nuclear power plants that generate most of the world‚Äôs electricity have to be kept cool in order to function properly. However, this will be increasingly challenging as the world gets warmer.

tweets.text:
"In thermal power plants, just 30-50% of the energy stored in the coal, gas or nuclear fuel is used to generate electricity. The rest of the energy is dissipated as heat ‚Äì & lots of it"
#SayNo2SizewellC @KwasiKwarteng @annietrev  @beisgovuk @EnvAgency 
https://t.co/AQjVDjv0gh

tweets.text: @DefraGovUK @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @ForestryComm Crisis of Nature in UK National Parks not primarily due to underfunding?  But overexploitation?    Previous agricultural subsidies, but also traffic, commerce, outdoor recreational events and facilities, big shoots, new house building and visitor amusements and facilities.
